Forward#

Operations within a forward context interact with the model’s forward pass.

nnsight.models.AbstractModel.forward(inputs: Union[torch.tensor, List], *args, **kwargs) → Runner#

Function implemented by all nnsight models that returns an instance of the nnsight.contexts.Runner class.

Parameters:

input (Union[torch.tensor, List]) – Batch or sequence of tokens in string or tensor format.

class Runner(model: 'AbstractModel', input: Union[torch.tensor, List], *args, inference=False, **kwargs) → None#

The Runner class orchestrates the execution of the model either for inference or training. It sets up an execution graph and manages inputs, outputs, and interventions during the model run.

Parameters:

  • model (AbstractModel) – The model object this runner is for.

  • input (Union[torch.tensor, List]) – The input data for the model.

  • args – Additional arguments for the model.

  • inference (bool) – Whether the model is being run in inference mode. Default is False.

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments for the model.

model#

The model object this runner is for.

input#

The input data for the model.

inference#

Whether the model is being run in inference mode.

args#

Additional arguments for the model.

kwargs#

Additional keyword arguments for the model.

graph#

The execution graph for managing interventions during the model run.

batch_size#

The current size of the batch being processed.

prompts#

A list of prompts used by the runner.

generation_idx#

The current generation index, useful for managing interventions.

output#

The output of the model after execution.

__enter__() → Runner#

Prepares the runner for a model execution session.

__exit__(exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb) → None#

Cleans up after a model execution session and runs the model with the provided inputs and arguments.

Examples#

# Other imports
from nnsight.toolbox.optim.lora import LORA
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader, Dataset

# ... rest of your code

for epoch in range(epochs):

    for i, (inputs, targets) in enumerate(dataloader):

        optimizer.zero_grad()
        with model.forward(inputs, inference=False) as runner:
            lora()
            logits = model.lm_head.output.save()

        loss = lossfn(logits.value[:, -1], targets)

        loss.backward()
        optimizer.step()

# ... rest of your code
